source_sentence: 梵志頞波羅延問種尊經
translation: Sutra of the Questions of Brahmā Upāli

source_sentence: 東晉西域三藏竺曇無蘭譯
translation: Translated by the Tripiṭaka of the Western Regions of the Eastern Jin Dynasty, translated by Zhu Dharmakṣema

source_sentence: 聞如是：一時，佛在舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園，時有五百比丘俱。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, while the Buddha was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī, accompanied by five hundred monks.

source_sentence: 舍衛城中有婆羅門五百人，五百人相將俱出城，自至其田廬，相與共坐講議言：「本初起地上人時，
translation: In the city of Śrāvastī there were five hundred brahmans. Five hundred brahmans came out of the city with their armies and went on their way to a hut in the field, where they sat and talked among themselves. They said: At the time of the first arising of the earthly gods (i.e., Brahmā’s enlightenment).

source_sentence: 皆是我曹婆羅門種，第二種者剎利，第三種者田家，第四種者工師，我曹種最尊。
translation: They are all my caste of brāhmaṇas. The second is the kṣatriya caste, the third caste is the khaṭṭika caste, and the fourth caste is the worker caste. My caste is the most venerable.

source_sentence: 初起地上作人時，皆是我曹種，初生時從口中出，今世人反從下出，在天下者，
translation: When they were first born, they came forth from their mouths. The people of this world now come forth from the bottom instead. Those who are in the realm under heaven (i.e., human beings) will not be able to do so.

source_sentence: 我曹種為最尊。
translation: My caste is the most honored one.

source_sentence: 我曹種皆是第七梵天子孫，佛反言天下一種耳，佛皆持我曹種，與剎利、田家、工師種等。
translation: My caste is all the descendants of the seventh deva god Brahmā. The Buddha said in reply, “The world is one and the same as ours” (i.e., my caste), whereas the Buddha maintained a caste similar to that of the khattiya, kṣatriya, pratyekabuddha, worker, and so on.

source_sentence: 我曹種死皆上梵天，佛反持我曹種，與凡人等，自相與議。
translation: When my caste dies, they'll all go up to the Brahma heavens, where the Buddha returns with me as his caste and discusses it with ordinary people.

source_sentence: 誰能與佛共講議分別是種者？」
translation: Who will be able to discuss this kind of distinction with the Buddha?

source_sentence: 時有婆羅門，有一子年十五六，字頞波羅延大聖，明工書、知方來之事，
translation: At that time there was a brahman who had a son, fifteen or sixteen years old, called Upāliyana the Great Sage. He was skilled in calligraphy and knew the affairs of his native land.

source_sentence: 五百婆羅門中，無有能與等者，皆師事之，能說經知天下事。
translation: Among the five hundred brahmans, there was none who could equal them. They all served him as their teacher and taught him the scriptures that would enable him to know the affairs of the world.

source_sentence: 頞波羅延大聖身有奇相，諸婆羅門自共議言：「獨頞波羅延能與佛共談，
translation: The Mahāprajāpaṇa had a marvelous body, and the brahmans debated among themselves, saying, “Only Mahāprajāpaṇa alone can talk to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 我曹皆不能與佛共談。」
translation: Neither of us can talk to the Buddha together.

source_sentence: 五百人共告頞波羅延言：「佛以天下人為一種，我曹種與剎利、田家、工師異，
translation: The five hundred monks said to Upālian, “The Buddha considers the people of Jambudvīpa to be one and the same class. My caste is different from that of the kṣatriyas, as well as from that of farmers and craftsmen.

source_sentence: 我曹種從梵天來下，生從口出，今世人生反從下出。
translation: My caste comes down from the Brahma heavens and comes out of my mouth when I'm born, but in this life, it comes back up from below.

source_sentence: 佛言：『天下有四種，四種皆佳。』
translation: The Buddha said, 'There are four kinds in the world, and the four kinds are all good.'

source_sentence: 願頞波羅延自屈俱往與佛共講。」
translation: May Kauṇḍinya bend himself and go together with the Buddha to discuss it.

source_sentence: 頞波羅延言：「佛持正道，能答應正道者，欲持婆羅門種往，不其有持道道正也。」
translation: Upālian said, The Buddha maintains the right path, and he can answer those who follow the right path if they want to carry the Brāhmaṇa lineage or go there, but it's not true that someone who maintains the path is correct.

source_sentence: 五百人皆言：「我曹持頞波羅延作師，何為不往講是四種事？」
translation: The five hundred people all said, Why don't we go and talk about these four kinds of things as our teacher, Kauṇḍinya?

source_sentence: 如是者再三，頞波羅延即起，與五百人俱到佛所祇樹。
translation: After repeating this three times, Upālian rose up and went to the Buddha's fig tree with five hundred people.

source_sentence: 阿難白佛：「有婆羅門子字頞波羅延，年十五六，所從五百長老婆羅門，
translation: Ānanda said to the Buddha: There was a brāhmaṇa called Ambapālīan, fifteen or sixteen years old.

source_sentence: 來在外。」
translation: They come from outside.

source_sentence: 佛言：「呼入。」
translation: The Buddha said, Call it in.

source_sentence: 阿難出，請頞波羅延入。
translation: Ānanda came out and invited Upālian to enter.

source_sentence: 頞波羅延等五百人皆住，不為佛作禮，自說言：「我有小事欲問佛。」
translation: Upālian and the five hundred others all stayed there, didn't venerate the Buddha, and said to themselves, I have a minor matter to ask the Buddha.

source_sentence: 佛言：「可坐。」
translation: The Buddha said, You can sit down.

source_sentence: 頞波羅延白佛：「我欲有所問，寧可相答？」
translation: Upālian said to the Buddha, I want to ask a question, so why wouldn't you answer it?

source_sentence: 佛言：「有所疑者便說之。」
translation: The Buddha said, Explain it if you have doubts.

source_sentence: 頞波羅延言：「我曹種道說與剎利、田家、工師種異，言我曹種是梵天子孫，
translation: Upālian said, “My caste is different from that of the kṣatriyas and brāhmaṇas. I say that my caste is a descendant of Brahmā.

source_sentence: 我曹先祖初生時皆從口出，死皆上天。」
translation: When my ancestors were first born, they all came out of their mouths and died in heaven.

source_sentence: 佛報言：「我經不道說異種。
translation: The Buddha replied, My sūtras don't teach different kinds.

source_sentence: 若婆羅門娶剎利女，剎利女為生子；
translation: If a brahman takes a kṣatriya woman, the kṣatriya woman is his newborn child.

source_sentence: 剎利娶田家女，田家女為生子；
translation: The kṣatriyas take the daughter of a field householder and the daughter of a field householder is their newborn child.

source_sentence: 田家娶工師女，工師女為生子；
translation: The farmer’s family married a woman skilled in the arts and crafts, who became their newborn child.

source_sentence: 工師娶婆羅門女，婆羅門女為生子。」
translation: The artisan married a Brāhmaṇa woman, and the Brāhmaṇa woman gave birth to a child.

source_sentence: 佛言：「我經中以施行為本，施行善者最為大種，其天下尊貴者，皆施行善得耳，
translation: The Buddha said: In my scripture, the practice of austerity is the foundation and the practice of virtue is the foremost of the great elements. All the noble people in the world will attain it by practicing virtue.

source_sentence: 不以種得也。
translation: It's not attained by planting seeds.

source_sentence: 我先世無數劫時，亦作婆羅門子，亦作剎利子，亦作田家子，亦作工師子，
translation: Countless eons ago I was also a brahman, a warrior, a ksatriya, a farmer, and a worker.

source_sentence: 自致為王子，今身為佛。」
translation: I myself became a prince, but now I'm the Buddha.

source_sentence: 佛告頞波羅延：「我問若一事，若如事說之。」
translation: The Buddha told Upālian, If I ask a question about one thing, or if I explain it in terms of the other things.

source_sentence: 佛言：「若見世間人善家子為人作奴，奴反免為人作子不？」
translation: The Buddha said, Suppose you see a good family of people in the world who serve as slaves for someone, and isn't that slave serving as a child for someone?

source_sentence: 頞波羅延白佛言：「我聞月支國中有是。」
translation: Upālian said to the Buddha, I've heard that this is the case in the moon kingdom.

source_sentence: 佛言：「是何等故？」
translation: The Buddha said, What's the reason?

source_sentence: 「善家子反作奴，奴反為人作子，是奴志意施行善故，人用作子，子作奴者，
translation: Again, the son of a good family becomes a slave [to others] and the slave becomes a child for someone else. This is because the slave desires to do good deeds with his mind. People make him a child; children make him a slave.

source_sentence: 志意施行惡故，自賣為人作奴耳。」
translation: Because they want to do evil, they sell themselves as slaves for others.

source_sentence: 「若曹言人有種如是者，人種在何所？」
translation: If Cao said that there are such kinds of people, where will the human race be?

source_sentence: 佛言：「若有婆羅門、剎利、田家、工師是四種，甚為憙殺、憙盜、憙婬、憙兩舌、憙惡口、憙妄言、憙讒人、喜與癡人相隨、喜瞋怒、喜祠祀。
translation: The Buddha said, Suppose there are four kinds of Brāhmaṇas, kṣatriyas, pratyekabuddhas, and skillful artisans who are greatly concerned with sexual misconduct, stealing, sexual misconduct, harshness, divisive speech, anger, false speech, debauchery, licentiousness, hatred that accompanies

source_sentence: 作是行者，寧墮地獄中不？」
translation: Would someone who does this kind of practice fall into hell?

source_sentence: 頞波羅延言：「婆羅門種說，雖有是惡，我種最尊，是梵天子孫，生從口出，
translation: Upālian said: Although the brahmans say that there is evil, we are the most venerable of the brāhmaṇas. We are the offspring of Brahmā and came into existence through our mouths.

source_sentence: 死皆當上天。」
translation: They'll all die and go up to heaven.

source_sentence: 佛言：「其有婆羅門、剎利、田家、工師種，無殺心、無盜心、無婬心、無兩舌心、無惡口心、無妄言心，
translation: The Buddha said: If there are any among the brāhmaṇas, kṣatriyas, arhats, and skilled artisans who have no thoughts of killing, no thoughts of stealing, no thoughts of anger, no thoughts of divisive speech, no thoughts of harsh words, and no thoughts of falsehood,

source_sentence: 無憙讒人心、無憙隨愚癡心，無憙瞋恚心、祠祀心，如是死者不生天上耶？」
translation: If there's no anger, no anger that follows folly, no anger and anger, and no mind of sacrifice, won't the deceased be born in heaven?

source_sentence: 頞波羅延言：「如是，皆生天上。」
translation: Upālian said, So it is, they'll all be born in heaven.

source_sentence: 佛言：「若說種類者在何所？」
translation: The Buddha said, Where is the person who teaches about types?

source_sentence: 佛言：「人種類皆從心意識出。
translation: The Buddha said, All kinds of people are produced from the mind and consciousnesses.

source_sentence: 心意識施行善者，生天上人間；
translation: Those who do good deeds with awarenesses and thinking are born in heaven or among humans.

source_sentence: 心意識惡者，入虫獸畜生、鬼神、地獄道中。
translation: The bad one of awarenesses and consciousness of the mind goes into the realms of insects, animals, animals, ghosts and goddesses or hells.

source_sentence: 其有婆羅門、剎利、田家、工師種，施行惡者，同入三惡道中。
translation: If there are any brāhmaṇas, kṣatriyas, vaiśyas, or skillful artisans who commit evil, they'll all enter the three bad destinies.

source_sentence: 如是者，種在何所？
translation: Where are these seeds planted?

source_sentence: 婆羅門種施行亦有善惡，剎利種施行亦有善惡，田家種施行亦有善惡，
translation: Good and bad are also found in the conduct of the brāhmaṇas; good and bad are found in the conduct of the kṣatriyas; and there are also good and bad in the conduct of the countrymen.

source_sentence: 工師種施行亦有善惡。
translation: The artisan's practice also has good and bad qualities.

source_sentence: 若曹自說言有種，如是種為在何所？
translation: If Cao himself says there are seeds, where would such seeds be?

source_sentence: 若婆羅門持意怨是虛空，剎利田家工師亦怨是虛空，不能中傷也，用意言等，
translation: If a Brāhmaṇa maintains that enemies are space, and if the kṣatriya field-worker also resents space, he won't be injured by them.

source_sentence: 但婆羅門持意自貢高世間耳。
translation: It's just that the Brāhmaṇa maintains his intention to self-exalt himself in the world.

source_sentence: 婆羅門種、剎利田家工師種，入大溪水中各自浴，垢墮水中，寧能別知是婆羅門垢、剎利垢、田家垢、工師垢不？」
translation: When the Brāhmaṇas and the artisans of the Śāriputra's field enter a large stream to bathe each other in water and fall into the water, how can they know separately whether this is the stain of the Brāhmaṇa, the stain of the Śāriputra, the stain of the farmhouse, or the stain of the artisan?

source_sentence: 頞波羅延言：「垢在大溪水中，當知在何所。」
translation: Upālian said, Where will you know where the dirt is in the great river?

source_sentence: 「若尚不知人垢，反言我種在天上，本從口出，餘人從下出，我種人中最尊貴。」
translation: If someone doesn't yet know the stain of humans, they say, 'My seeds are in heaven, which originally came out from my mouth, and the rest came out from below, which is the most noble of my seeds.'

source_sentence: 佛告頞波羅延：「若國王聞某國某郡縣某聚落，有婆羅門及子高明，有剎利及子高明，
translation: The Buddha told Upālian, Suppose a king of a certain country hears that in a certain country, a certain prefecture, or a certain village, there are brāhmaṇas and sons with lofty intellects, and there are kṣatriyas and sons with lofty intellects.

source_sentence: 有田家及子高明，有工師及子高明，王即徵召俱為王臣，王豈問種類耶？
translation: If there were farmers and their children who were arrogant and bright, and if there were artisans and their children who were arrogant and bright, the king would summon them to serve as his ministers, so wouldn't the king ask about their types?

source_sentence: 其高才明達者，王即先與好郡國。
translation: He was a man of high talent and insight, so the king gave him the good prefecture first.

source_sentence: 王何以不問子種類？
translation: Why didn't the king ask about the types of children?

source_sentence: 若曹言有種類者，為頞波羅延！
translation: If Cao says there are kinds, it's Upālian!

source_sentence: 若戒在何所？
translation: Where are the precepts?

source_sentence: 從諸長老坐在長老上，是五百人，何以不責若種類、若作師？
translation: When the elders were seated on top of the elders, there were five hundred people who didn't blame those of different kinds and those who became teachers.

source_sentence: 其有婆羅門、剎利、田家、工師種及餘種，寒時俱在大火邊，火熱不獨至一種所，
translation: In the cold season, they're all at the edge of a great fire, and the hot fire doesn't go alone to one place.

source_sentence: 溫熱皆等耳。
translation: They're all equal in warmth and heat.

source_sentence: 若有大船渡水，婆羅門、剎利、田家、工師種俱在一船上，渡船不獨渡婆羅門種，
translation: If there's a large boat crossing water, the brāhmaṇas, kṣatriyas, farmers, and artisans are all in one boat, and it's not just the brāhmaṇas who cross the boat.

source_sentence: 亦不獨渡餘種。」
translation: Nor are they the only ones who cross over to other kinds.

source_sentence: 佛問頞波羅延：「若婆羅門、剎利、田家、工師種亦餘種子，在母腹中，
translation: The Buddha asked Upāliyan, Suppose a Brāhmaṇa, a kṣatriya, a farmer, or a worker were to plant other seeds in his mother's womb.

source_sentence: 時同十月，有增減耶？」
translation: Is the time the same as ten months, with increase and decrease?

source_sentence: 頞波羅延言：「皆十月耳，無有增減也。」
translation: Upālian said, They're all ten months, and there's no increase or decrease.

source_sentence: 「若曹何以說言我種梵天子孫，生從口出？
translation: “Suppose Cao said, ‘I am a descendant of the god Brahmā.

source_sentence: 婆羅門種、剎利種、田家種、工師種亦餘種，日月何以不獨照若一種？
translation: The brāhmaṇa class, the kṣatriya class, the田家 class, and the worker class are also other classes, so why isn't the sun and moon shining alone if it's one type?

source_sentence: 何為并照餘種？」
translation: What's the point of illuminating the other kinds together?

source_sentence: 頞波羅延言：「我種自說言勝餘種。」
translation: Upālian said, My type says it's superior to the other kinds on its own.

source_sentence: 佛告頞波羅延：「有驢父馬母，馬為生子，名是何等？」
translation: The Buddha told Upālian, There's a donkey father and a horse mother, and a horse is the newborn child; what's its name?

source_sentence: 頞波羅延言：「名騾。
translation: Upālian said, It's called a dispute.

source_sentence: 父亦不字為騾，母亦不字為騾。」
translation: A father who doesn't say anything is deceitful, and a mother who doesn't say anything is deceitful.

source_sentence: 「若何以字為騾？」
translation: Why is it that words are used as arrows?

source_sentence: 「我先祖呼作騾，我隨言騾。」
translation: My ancestors called me to make a dispute, and I made a dispute according to my words.

source_sentence: 「有馬父驢母，驢為生子，若名為何等字為駏驉？
translation: If there's a horse father, a donkey mother, and a donkey is his newborn child, what words are the words that are crude if they're called crude?

source_sentence: 父亦不字為駏驉，母亦不字為駏驉，若何知為駏驉？」
translation: A father who doesn't say anything is angry, and a mother who doesn't say anything is angry, so what does he know to be angry?

source_sentence: 「我先祖呼為駏驉，因隨言駏驉。」
translation: My ancestors called it anger because they followed the words of anger.

source_sentence: 「婆羅門娶剎利女，剎利女為生子，當名為何等？
translation: What's the name of a Brāhmaṇa who takes a kṣatriya woman and makes a kṣatriya woman his child?

source_sentence: 當言婆羅門種？
translation: Should it be called the Brāhmaṇa type?

source_sentence: 剎利種？」
translation: The kṣatriyas?

source_sentence: 頞波羅延言：「不知當呼何種？」
translation: Upālian said, I don't know what kind to call it.

source_sentence: 佛言：「若不自知類，何以名騾、駏驉？
translation: The Buddha said, If you don't know your own type, why are they called crude and crude?

source_sentence: 剎利女為婆羅門生子，入若門中，隨若祠祀，隨若種類，是兒然後高明，
translation: The kṣatriya woman gave birth to a son of the brāhmaṇa and entered any gate, wherever she worshipped him or offered sacrifices to him. Such a child would then become very wealthy.

source_sentence: 若曹當承事當出去？
translation: If Cao will serve him, he'll go out?

source_sentence: 我曹當承事？
translation: Will I serve you?

source_sentence: 婆羅門娶田家女，田家女為生子，子有殺心、有盜心、有婬心、有兩舌心、有惡口心、有妄言心、有讒人心、有憙隨愚癡心、有瞋恚心、有祠祀心，
translation: When a brāhmaṇa takes a daughter of a wealthy family and gives birth to a son, the son has thoughts of killing, stealing, anger, divisive speech, harsh words, false speech, hatred, folly, anger, hatred, hostility, hatred, debauchery, and veneration.

source_sentence: 有是行者，若曹與相隨不？」
translation: If there's a practitioner like this, will he follow it with Cao?

source_sentence: 「我曹不與相隨。
translation: “We won’t follow each other.

source_sentence: 子心意識施行惡，我曹當逐出，不內我曹群輩中。」
translation: When the son's mind and consciousness commit evil, I will chase them out of my caste and not be among those in my caste.

source_sentence: 佛言：「若曹自說是梵天子孫，生從口出，死當上天。
translation: The Buddha said, Suppose Cao himself says that he's a descendant of the Brahma gods who are born out of his mouth and die in the higher heavens.

source_sentence: 若曹但見心意識施行惡便生相逐，何為道說種類？」
translation: If Cao simply sees that the mind and consciousness act badly, then what kind of path does he teach?

source_sentence: 佛言：「若有婆羅門種，中有不孝父母者，憙殺盜行十惡者，死當趣何道？」
translation: The Buddha said, If there are people of the Brāhmaṇa family who aren't filial to their parents and commit the ten bad crimes of killing and stealing, what path will they follow when they die?

source_sentence: 頞波羅延言：「心意識施行如是者，死當入地獄中。」
translation: Upālian said, If someone's mind and consciousness act like this, they'll die and go to hell.

source_sentence: 佛言：「若曹言，我種本梵天，生從口出，於人中最尊。
translation: The Buddha said, Suppose you say, 'I'm originally born in the Brahma Heaven and emerge from my mouth as the most honored among humans.

source_sentence: 何為入地獄中？」
translation: What's the point of entering hell?

source_sentence: 佛言：「天下人無種類、無有常高明者。
translation: The Buddha said, There are no kinds of people in the world and there's no such person who is always so lofty.

source_sentence: 心意志善、施行好，是為尊貴；
translation: The goodness of mind and thought and the goodness of action are their noble qualities.

source_sentence: 心意、施行惡，是為下賤。」
translation: To do evil with one's mind and volition is to be inferior.

source_sentence: 頞波羅延自思念：「我本不欲來，眾人共使我來。」
translation: Upālian thought to himself, I didn't want to come here in the first place; the people will send me here together.

source_sentence: 自思惟：「我本意不得與佛諍，我續言佛道正。」
translation: He thought to himself, I didn't originally want to fight with the Buddha, but I continue to say that the Buddha Way is correct.

source_sentence: 佛言：「若本時言人當種佳，今反就我言心意志佳。」
translation: The Buddha said, If you used to say people will be good at planting good seeds, now you're saying that my mind and will are good at doing so.

source_sentence: 頞波羅延自思念：「佛語遮我前後。」
translation: Upālian thought to himself, The Buddha's words obscure me before and after.

source_sentence: 佛告頞波羅延：「乃往去時有七婆羅門，皆有道，日日祠祀於天。
translation: The Buddha told Upālian, There were seven brāhmaṇas on their way there, all of whom had the Way and offered sacrifices to the gods day after day.

source_sentence: 七婆羅門亦自道說：『我是梵天子孫，我曹生亦從口出，凡人從下出，
translation: The seven brāhmaṇas also said to themselves, “We are the offspring of Brahmā. Our cakravartin also comes forth from our mouths. Ordinary people come forth from below.

source_sentence: 我種與凡人異，我種死皆當上天。』」
translation: My seeds are different from ordinary people, and my seeds will all die up in heaven.'

source_sentence: 佛言：「我是時亦作道人，字阿洫，眾人共呼我道為天道。
translation: The Buddha said, At the time, I was also a practitioner of the Way, whose name was Akṣobhya, and all the people together called my path the heavenly path.

source_sentence: 我是時見七婆羅門乃在焰火祠，諸婆羅門皆言：『我曹死當如是，火光當上天。』」
translation: I then saw seven Brāhmaṇas in a blazing fire shrine, and the Brāhmaṇas all said, 'So it will be with me when I die; the light of the fire will go up to heaven.'

source_sentence: 佛言：「我見子曹所為，我自變身體，手持黃金柄幢旄，身著白衣，從人假車而往至七婆羅門所。
translation: The Buddha said, “I see what Ziqiao has done. I have transformed myself into a bodhisattva, carrying a golden-colored silk banner in my hand and white clothes on my body, leaving the carriage behind to go to the place of seven brahmans.

source_sentence: 七婆羅門時經行，及子曹見我，呼我作：『婆羅門！
translation: When seven Brāhmaṇas were walking, they saw me and called out to me, 'Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 道從何所來？』
translation: Where did the path come from?'

source_sentence: 七婆羅門言：『若是天道，略與我等，何以著好衣載車手持黃金幢？
translation: The seven brāhmaṇas said, 'If this is the divine path, why would you give it to us so briefly? Why would you wear good clothing and carry a chariot with your hands holding a golden banner?'

source_sentence: 若從何所生？
translation: If it arises from what?

source_sentence: 欲至何所？
translation: Where do you want to go?

source_sentence: 從何所來？
translation: Where did it come from?

source_sentence: 何以來到是間？』
translation: How did you come to this place?'

source_sentence: 時我不與語。
translation: At the time, I didn't say anything to him.

source_sentence: 子曹見我不語，皆瞋，既呪我，欲令我住死。
translation: They all became angry and cursed me, wanting to cause me to live and die.

source_sentence: 子曹呪我，我面更好；
translation: If you curse me, my countenance will be better.

source_sentence: 子曹更復呪，我面色復重好。
translation: Zi Cao then repeated the spell, and my complexion became even more beautiful.

source_sentence: 七婆羅門大驚言：『我曹所呪者皆死；
translation: The seven brahmans were greatly startled and said, “All the spells I cast will all die.

source_sentence: 今我呪之，面色復更好？』
translation: Now that I've cursed it, will my face become even better?'

source_sentence: 更復呼阿洫。
translation: Again, he called out to Anavatapta.

source_sentence: 自思念：『子欲趣何等道？』
translation: He thought to himself, 'What path does the child want to follow?'

source_sentence: 阿洫即答言：『我道意勝，若曹何為怒？
translation: Akṣobhya then replied, 'I'm superior in my way of teaching, so why would I be angry if he were to do so?'

source_sentence: 若曹聞阿洫道天道不？』
translation: Suppose Cao hears the abhidharma path and the heavenly path?'

source_sentence: 子曹言：『我不聞。』
translation: Zi Cao said, 'I won't hear it.'

source_sentence: 『賢者道人！
translation: 'Good man, you're a practitioner!

source_sentence: 相見當相問，何為相瞋？』
translation: What's the characteristic of anger when you see each other and ask questions?'

source_sentence: 阿洫言：『我聞若曹說，天下婆羅門為梵天子孫，生從口出，人中獨尊。
translation: Ānanda said: I have heard you say that the brahmans of the world are the offspring of Brahmā, born from his mother’s mouth. They are the only honored ones among humans.

source_sentence: 用是故來相問：「若起是火祠天，祠天若法何師道得？
translation: Because of this, they came to each other and asked, If this is the fire deity who gives rise to it, what teacher will teach them the teaching if they do so?

source_sentence: 無復從先祖聞。」』
translation: I won't hear it again from my ancestors.'

source_sentence: 七婆羅門言：『我先祖為我曹效耳。』
translation: Seven, the Brāhmaṇa said, 'My ancestors served as my servants.'

source_sentence: 阿洫道人言：『若曹先祖母是婆羅門女、他人女？』
translation: The abhidharma practitioner said, 'Suppose Cao's late grandmother is a Brāhmaṇa or someone else's daughter.'

source_sentence: 言：『我曹不知先祖母剎利女、田家女、工師女？』
translation: He said, 'Didn't I know that my late grandmother was the daughter of the kṣatriya, the daughter of the farmer, or the daughter of the artisan?'

source_sentence: 『我不知若先祖母為婆羅門生，若曹愛他人生若曹種類，若殊不知先祖，
translation: 'I don't know whether my former grandmother was born as a brāhmaṇa, whether she loved someone else or some other kind of people, or if she didn't know her ancestors.

source_sentence: 何以知先祖從梵天來生？
translation: How do we know that our ancestors were born in Brahmā Heaven?

source_sentence: 女人心不可保？
translation: A woman's mind can't be preserved?

source_sentence: 若曹能知世間人，夫婦合會云何生子？』
translation: If Cao can know the people of the world, how will he give birth to a child when his husband and wife are united?'

source_sentence: 子曹皆言我不知。
translation: They all said, I don't know.

source_sentence: 『若亦不知先祖，亦不知人所生，何為向我瞋怒？
translation: 'If you also don't know your ancestors and don't know where people are born, why would you become angry toward me?

source_sentence: 凡人相見，當先相勞問高下，當知人意志乃可怒，何為先怒？
translation: When ordinary people see each other, they should first ask questions about the height of their troubles. You should know that human will is capable of being angry, so why would you be angry first?

source_sentence: 若知子初入腹中時不？
translation: Do you know when the child first enters your womb?

source_sentence: 父有貪婬之態，母有愛慕之心，所當為作子者，三合成子。
translation: The father has a state of craving and the mother has an affectionate mind, and what should be done as a child is that three are combined into one child.

source_sentence: 所當為子者，誰令溫意得父母乃成為子？
translation: Who will cause Wenyi to attain parents and become a child?

source_sentence: 子在腹中，或先世作惡，今在腹中或盲或聾、或瘂或傴、或跛或杌，父母皆不知。
translation: When the child was in his belly, he might have done evil in a previous life. But now he's in his belly, whether blind or deaf, dumb or hunchbacked, crippled or hoarse, and not known to his parents.

source_sentence: 近父母懷子在腹中，尚不能知其子好醜，若曹何以知先祖是梵天子孫，
translation: If the father and mother were to carry their child in their wombs, they would not even know the beauty or ugliness of that child. How could they have known that his ancestors are the offspring of Brahma?

source_sentence: 生從口出，人中獨尊？』」
translation: What's the only honored among men who come out of their mouth to be born?'

source_sentence: 佛告頞波羅延：「先世時七婆羅門尚能呪殺人，是時我不聽子曹，所語亦不錄也。
translation: The Buddha told Upālian, In a previous life, seven Brāhmaṇas were still capable of cursing people and killing people, but at the time I didn't listen to their words, nor did I record them.

source_sentence: 今我作佛，若復來道說，我梵天子孫，生從口出，人中獨尊。」
translation: Now that I've become a buddha, if I come back to the path and teach it, my Brahmā descendants will be born from their mouths, and they'll be the sole honored among humans.

source_sentence: 佛告頞波羅延：「思惟我所語，天下生子，養者為父母，成者師也。」
translation: The Buddha told Upālian, Consider what I say: When a child is born in the world, those who raise it are parents and those who become teachers.

source_sentence: 頞波羅延婆羅門，又與五百婆羅門及諸婆羅門共思惟：「我往時尚為七婆羅門作師，
translation: The brāhmaṇa Ambapālīan thought to himself, “I formerly served as a teacher for seven brahmans.

source_sentence: 七婆羅門皆道德人，能呪殺人；
translation: The seventh is that all the brahmans are people of morality, able to incantate murderers.

source_sentence: 我於今分別道說：『是人有種，一為百百為千，千為萬萬為一。』」
translation: Now, I'll discern the path and say, 'This person has a seed, which is one for a hundred hundred or a thousand, and a thousand or ten million for one.'

source_sentence: 頞波羅延及諸婆羅門俱前，以頭面著佛足：「不審一為百百為千，千為萬萬為一。
translation: Upāliyani and the other brāhmaṇas all went forward, bowed their heads and feet at the Buddha’s feet, and said: I do not know whether one [figure] is a hundred-thousand [figures] or a thousand [figures].

source_sentence: 是者何謂？」
translation: What does this mean?

source_sentence: 佛言：「是世間人貪樂生死者眾多，一人生子孫，然後更分為百家，百家求道一道耳。
translation: The Buddha said, There are so many people in the world who crave birth and death, with one person born as a descendant, then they'll be divided into a hundred families, and a hundred families will seek the path.

source_sentence: 何等為一道？
translation: What's one path?

source_sentence: 謂無為道。
translation: It's the path of nonexistence.

source_sentence: 如是者一為千，千為萬。」
translation: Thus, one is a thousand and a thousand are ten thousand.

source_sentence: 頞波羅延前長跪言：「寧可哀畜我曹，如哀沙門，莫有恨心，於我曹所請，
translation: Upālian knelt down in front of him and said, “May your holiness have mercy on me! Please take pity on me.

source_sentence: 歸相撿斂。」
translation: They return to each other and examine and constrain them.

source_sentence: 佛言「善！
translation: The Buddha said, Good!

source_sentence: 若曹朝來不食。」
translation: Suppose Cao comes in the morning and doesn't eat.

source_sentence: 皆起，以頭面著佛足，去。
translation: They all got up, put their heads and faces at the Buddha’s feet, and departed.

source_sentence: 梵志頞波羅延問種尊經
translation: Sutra of the Questions of Brahmā Upāli
